html.p: Definition. Let [mathjaxinline]{\bf {F}}[/mathjaxinline] be a field. A function [mathjaxinline]T: {\bf {F}}^ n \rightarrow {\bf {F}}^ m[/mathjaxinline] is a linear transformation if both of the following properties hold:

li.p: For any vectors [mathjaxinline]v, w[/mathjaxinline] in the domain, [mathjaxinline]T(v + w) = T(v) + T(w).[/mathjaxinline]
For any vector [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] in the domain, and any scalar [mathjaxinline]a\in {\bf {F}}[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]T(av) = aT(v)[/mathjaxinline].

html.p: Informally, if [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] satisfies the first condition we say that “[mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] respects vector addition", and if [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] satisfies the second condition we say that “[mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] respects scalar multiplication."
